greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^(n-k)*A000041(k).
comment: Essentially first differences of A024786 (see the formula). Also, a(n) is the number of 2's in the last section of the set of partitions of n+2 (see A135010). - _Omar E. Pol_, Sep 10 2008
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: (* more efficient program *) sig = 1; su = 1; Flatten[{1, Table[sig = -sig; su = su + sig*PartitionsP[n]; Abs[su], {n, 1, 50}]}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 06 2016 *)
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 07 2003
